com.milk.objed.gui
Class EditorControl

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.milk.objed.gui.EditorControl
public class EditorControl
extends java.lang.Object

This object is the major focus of external interaction. It knows how to hook up Editors with the GUI elements of this package. When asked to display a particular editor of class package.Class, it will turn around and attempt to find a class called package.gui.ClassComponent. If the class exists, it tries to call a static method:

static public EditorComponent makeComponent (Editor editor, EditorControl control);
to make the actual component. If any of that fails, it goes to the name of the superclass and tries again. If it hits Object and it still hasn't found a component, it resorts to a bare-bones display component.

Author:
Dan Bornstein, danfuzz@milk.com
, Copyright 1999 Dan Bornstein, all rights reserved.

Method Detail

edit

public Editor edit(java.lang.Object obj)
Get an editor for a given object or throw an UneditableException. Right now, this attempts to cast the object to Editable and then asks it for its editor. Eventually, this may do smart things to allow for non-explicitly-Editable objects to be edited.

Parameters:
obj - the object to edit
Returns:
an editor for the object
Throws:
UneditableException - thrown if the object cannot be edited

display

public void display(Editor editor)
Display the given editor. If it is already being displayed, move it to the front.

Parameters:
editor - the editor to display

makeComponent

public EditorComponent makeComponent(Editor editor)
Given an Editor return an EditorComponent to interact with it. It does all the steps outlined in the class description.

Parameters:
editor - the editor to interact with
Returns:
an editor component that interacts with the given editor
